From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To configure the username for File Transfer Protocol (FTP) connections, use the **ip ftp username** command in global configuration mode. To configure the router to attempt anonymous FTP, use the **no** form of this command.
Examples: In the following example, the router is configured to use the username "red<"> and the password "blue"for FTP connections:
ExtraInfo: The remote username must be associated with an account on the destination server.

RelatedCmds.description: Configures the router to use only passive FTP connections.
Specifies the password to be used for FTP connections.
Specifies the source IP address for FTP connections.
